alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 16 at 10:14PM CDT until June 17 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Kimble County in west central Texas... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1010 PM CDT, Radar indicated thunderstorms with very heavy rain repeatedly developing over western Kimble County, along and north of Interstate 10. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches has already occurred in a short period of time, and an additional 1 to 2 inches is likely. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, street flooding in towns, highways, and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cleo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 440 and 454. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 275 crossing North Llano River and KC 210 crossing West Bear Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
